title: What is so good about 5G and what does it do vs 4G? - Quora

response.answer_text: Less power is used to transfer signals. Less interference with other signals. “More direct” connection with a device (like beam forming). Since you have many more antennas, much more devices can be served without using collision detection and avoidance tech in the back. Bandwidth, in theory. I doubt you'll see in practice though.
See my other answer Robert Harvey's answer to Do we need 5G or 6G technology? Why? Do you think that 4G is enough and we don't need more?
